snippet: Adel Abdul Bary, who pleaded guilty to conspiring to kill Americans, received “an enormously generous plea bargain,” a federal judge in Manhattan said.
abstract: Egyptian man Adel Abdul Bary receives 25-year prison sentence in plea agreement in which he admitted to helping Al Qaeda leader Osama bin Laden issue threats and claim responsibility for 1998 terrorist bombings of American embassies in Nairobi, Kenya, and Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.
lead_paragraph: Adel Abdul Bary, who pleaded guilty to conspiring to kill Americans, received “an enormously generous plea bargain,” a federal judge in Manhattan said.

headline.main: Egyptian Gets 25-Year Term in 1998 Embassy Bombings; Judge Calls Plea Deal Generous
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Gets 25-Year Term in 1998 Embassy Bombings; Judge Calls Plea Deal Generous
